data.title: Federal Reserve Chairman Powell: More and more officials want to postpone rate cuts
data.description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell stated that a growing number of Fed officials are prepared to postpone the upcoming interest rate cut. Powell said, "After the last two policy meetings where rates were cut, there was a sense that some officials wanted to take a wait-and-see approach. Now there is a growing consensus that perhaps we should at least wait one cycle." (Jinshi)

data.title: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell: If the economic situation remains stable and there are no new developments, the pace of interest rate cuts will slow.
data.description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell: If no new information is available and the economic situation appears unchanged, then there would be reason to slow the pace of interest rate cuts. (Jinshi)

data.title: Forget Cardano, Why Shiba Inu’s Shibarium Is The Real Ghost Chain
data.description:
Shiba Inu’s effort to grow beyond being a meme coin is struggling. Its blockchain network, Shibarium, was created to bring real use and value to the project, but it has not gained much attention or activity. Developer interest and user engagement are very low, and the network’s overall growth has slowed down sharply. Recent network issues, including technical troubles and security problems, have made things worse
source: https://www.newsbtc.com/shiba-inu/shiba-inu-shibarium-ghost-chain/

data.title: Fed mouthpiece: FOMC doesn't quite agree with market pricing in a December rate cut.
data.description: Nick Timiraos, often referred to as the "Federal Reserve mouthpiece," commented on Fed Chairman Powell's remarks, saying, "Powell's press conference indicates that the FOMC, as a whole, does not agree with the market's high pricing in a December rate cut." Powell stated, "We have very different views on how to act in December." He emphasized that a December rate cut "should not be seen as a done deal. In fact, it is far from it." This goes beyond their usual disclaimer that "policy does not follow a predetermined path," and is clearly an effort to regain some policy flexibility to avoid being forced to take a specific action. What if there is no government data to help clarify the economic situation? Powell pointed out that this means there is a "very high level of uncertainty, which could be a reason for cautious action." (Jinshi)

data.title: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell: It's unlikely that a very detailed understanding of the economy can be gained during a government shutdown.
data.description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell: During the government shutdown, we are unlikely to have a very detailed understanding of the economy. The Fed is referring to data from PriceStats and Adobe to assist in monitoring inflation. Private sector data cannot replace government statistics. (Jinshi)

data.title: Federal Reserve Chairman Powell: Inflation rate excluding tariffs is not far from the 2% target.
data.description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell: I don't believe tariffs will be a one-off inflation shock; the inflation rate excluding tariffs is not far from the 2% target. (Jinshi)

data.title: The "whale with a 100% win rate since October 11th" has accumulated a floating loss of $3.33 million on its long positions in BTC and SOL.
data.description: Hyperbot data shows that as BTC fell, the "whale with a 100% win rate since October 11th" had its long BTC orders filled again, with over 900 BTC traded. Its current positions are as follows: BTC 13x long position, valued at $113 million, opened at $110,123, with a floating profit of $150,000; SOL 10x long position, valued at $108 million, opened at $198.43, with a floating loss of $3.48 million.

data.title: Traders have lowered their bets on a December rate cut by the Federal Reserve.
data.description: Traders have lowered their bets on a December rate cut by the Federal Reserve, now expecting a 71% probability, down from 90% previously. (Jinshi)
